roleset.name: represents AJCC staging components (codes used to describe a cancer's status)

role.descr: entity being staged (cancer, manifestation of cancer, or entity with cancer. Cannot be a surgery)
other AJCC attributes (p, y, r, etc.)

example.name: with stage
example.text: This mass represents a stage I colon cancer with T2 , N0 , M0 .
example.amr: (r / represent-01 :ARG0 (s2 / sign-symptom :name (n2 / name :op1 "mass") :mod (t / this)) :ARG1 (c / cancer-03 :ARG2 (a / anatomical-site :name (n / name :op1 "colon")) :ARG1-of (s / stage-02 :ARG2 (a2 / ajcc-entity-91 :ARG1 c :ARG2 1 :ARG3 (t2 / tumor-stage-entity :value "T2") :ARG4 (l / lymph-stage-entity :value "N0") :ARG5 (m / mets-stage-entity :value "M0")))))

example.name: with ARG6
example.amr: (a / ajcc-entity-91 :ARG1 (s / sign-symptom :name (n / name :op1 "mass")) :ARG3 (t / tumor-stage-entity :value "T2") :ARG4 (l / lymph-stage-entity :value "N1") :ARG6 (s2 / string-entity :value "u"))

roleset.note: AJCC NOTES: Added for THYME-AMR. For AMR annotation: ARG3 should always be filled with tumor-stage-entity, ARG4 with lymph-stage-entity, ARG5 with mets-stage-entity. Use :value to link the code itself.
